definition: to tighten one's belt/to live more frugally
to rein in/to compel/to force/to carve/to engrave/(literary) to command/to lead/bridle/(physics) abbr. for 勒克斯[le4 ke4 si1], lux
tight/strict/close at hand/near/urgent/tense/hard up/short of money/to tighten
band/belt/girdle/ribbon/tire/area/zone/region/CL:條|条[tiao2]/to wear/to carry/to take along/to bear (i.e. to have)/to lead/to bring/to look after/to raise

sentences.english: If food is scarce it's no use complaining; we shall just have to pull in our belts.
sentences.chinese: 如果食品不足，抱怨也無用，我們將只得勒緊褲帶。

sentences.english: In days like these, we must tighten our belts and be team players.
sentences.chinese: 在這個特殊時期，我們必須要勒緊褲帶並團結協作。

sentences.english: When the food ran out we had to pull in our belt.
sentences.chinese: 沒有食物時，我們必須勒緊褲帶過日子。

sentences.english: Families are tightening their belts and so should Washington.
sentences.chinese: 許多家庭都在勒緊褲帶，華盛頓也應該如此。

sentences.english: We all have to tighten our belts until your father finds another job.
sentences.chinese: 在你父親找到另一份工作之前，我們都要勒緊褲帶。

sentences.english: Has the combination — tighten belts and raise prices — worked?
sentences.chinese: 勒緊褲帶和提高工資這兩項能共同存在嗎？

sentences.english: We've got to tighten our belts.
